news_header: Olli Rehn, CEO of the Bank of Finland, emphasizes the uncertainty in the euro area economy and the need for data-driven interest rate decisions.
news_text: Olli Rehn, the CEO of the Bank of Finland, stated that uncertainty in the euro area economy underscores the reliance on recent data and analysis. As a result, the Governing Council is not preemptively setting interest rates and has chosen to maintain flexibility in future interest rate decisions. The monetary policy decisions will be made in mid-December, based on a comprehensive assessment of inflation outlook, underlying inflation dynamics, and the effectiveness of monetary policy transmission.
